create a beautifully textured hat with the **wheat stitch™ crochet beanie**, a bottom-up design that’s stylish, warm, and easy to customize. this pattern includes sizes from newborn to adult large, making it a perfect choice for handmade gifts, market prep, or family sets.

***bonus! printable gift or market tags come with the paid pattern.***

you’ll start with a soft, stretchy ribbed brim worked flat in rows, then join and transition seamlessly into ***[my signature wheat stitch][1]*** for the body of the hat. for extra impact, switch colors every two rounds to create eye-catching stripes — or keep it classic with a solid color. simple decreases shape the crown, and the beanie is topped with a playful pompom (and optional tag for that personal maker’s touch).

whether you’re making your first hat or adding a new textured design to your shop lineup, the wheat stitch beanie is a modern classic you’ll come back to again and again.

a [video tutorial][2] is included in the pattern.

**abbreviations:**
blo- back loop only
ch - chain
flo - front loop only
rs - right side
sc - single crochet
sc2tog - single crochet two together
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)
ws - wrong side

**gauge:**
15 sts and 15 rows = 4" by 4" in stitch pattern repeat (see gauge swatch instructions), not blocked.
16 rows = 4 inches for ribbing

not sure what gauge is? check out this blog post:  [what is crochet gauge and how to fix it][13]
